intro: Jaltomata athahuallpae, commonly known as the Huayna Picchu morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its vines can climb or trail along the ground. Due to its limited distribution and unique habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
